lead_paragraph: At issue is whether military tribunals can prosecute future terrorism defendants for “conspiracy,” a charge not currently recognized by international law.

headline.print_headline: Appeals Court Backs Tribunal’s Conspiracy Conviction
headline.main: Guantánamo Detainee’s Conspiracy Conviction Upheld, but Legal Issue Lingers

snippet: At issue is whether military tribunals can prosecute future terrorism defendants for “conspiracy,” a charge not currently recognized by international law....
abstract: Federal appeals court upholds military commission conviction of Guantanamo Bay detainee Ali Hamza al-Bahlul for conspiring to commit war crimes; conviction is rare success for troubled military tribunals system; ruling does not resolve whether military commission can prosecute other terrorism defendants for conspiracy, which is not recognized as war crime recognized by international law.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: War Crimes, Genocide and Crimes Against Humanity
